item.title: The Growth of Diversity in Biomedical Research
Impacts and Echoes
item.description: Wotecki, C. E., Kramer, B. L., Lancaster, V. & Cohen, S. “Impacts and Echoes: The Lasting Influence of the White House Conference on Food, Nutrition and Health.” Accepted at Annual Review of Nutrition. Links to Interactive Website and GitHub Repository. The 1969 White House Conference on Food, Nutrition and Health was incredibly influential on the direction of food and nutrition policy in the United States. The conference produced recommendations leading to federal legislation and programs to alleviate hunger and malnutrition, improve consumer’s nutrition knowledge through education and labeling, and monitor the nutritional status of the population.
